result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas J Toutant

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:37 PM Defendant Nicholas J Toutant in court.  Attorney Erika Lynn Moore in court for Nicholas J Toutant.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Defense is requesting a change of plea date.
BTC: Date set, matters adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas J Toutant in court.  Attorney Erika Lynn Moore in court for Nicholas J Toutant. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
21CM1151 was scheduled for change of plea.
Deft has picked up two new files.
Defense was appointed on 21CM1151.
Defense is not appointed on the two new files.
Defense would ask that the Court appoint her on the deft's new files.
State takes no position but would ask that the deft go back to the SPD's office.
BTC: Atty to be appointed on the two new files, matters adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
State's Notice of intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence
State's Notice of intent to introduce 911 recordings
State's Notice of intent to use videotaped statements of a child under 12
State's Notice of intent to introduce Deft's statements
State's Notice of intent to introduce recorded statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim N.N.B (person, property, residence or family).

2:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas J Toutant appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Nicholas J Toutant. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State moves to dismiss counts 3 and 4 based on the complaint.
BTC: Counts 3 and 4 dismissed without prejudice due to lack of probable cause in the complaint. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
